item.title: Using Reticulate with Python and R
item.description: library(reticulate) py_install("numpy") To best explain the way that python and R work hand-in-hand, I’ve created this simple example below that explains the usefulness of “reticulate” when troubleshooting. I used the numpy package in python to create two variables, x and y. They are 100 values pulled from a random normal sample of with a mean of 5 and a standard deviation of 1. When I tried to make a scatter plot, however, I ran into a set of error messages with python that I didn’t know how to fix.
